oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A Comparison of Different Sugar Baits for the Capture of Diptera in Texas
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Marshall, Perri
Garcia, Cora
Wallace, Stevie
Warren, Shannon
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Identifying the most effective baits to attract Diptera flies is critical for surveillance and control activities. Four different baits consisting of sugar-water, molasses and water, a vinegar-syrup mixture, and a mango mosquito lure were used inside funnel kill traps and placed in various locations in the city of College Station, Tx and left out for five days at a time. Lucilia sericata (Meigen) was the most prevalent species collected, but others included Musca domestica (Linnaeus) and Drosophila melanogaster (Morgan). The molasses bait was the most effective trap, with sugar-water in a close second. The syrup-vinegar mixture did not effectively attract anything. Key Words: Diptera, Lucilia sericata, fly traps, funnel traps
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Instars: A Journal of Student Research; Vol. 6 No. 2 (2021): Instars: A Journal of Student Research
